content.raw:
I don't know... I have the impression that the fact that you need an `_offset` argument to specify its point of application means that this vector is not a "free vector". 
Just to give a comparison, a function like `AddLinkCouple(const math::Vector3 &_couple)` would not need an `_offset` argument, because  it does not matter where do you apply the couple. 

Anyway unless we use a formal semantic definition for this terms  (as done in [1], for example) it is just a matter of taste, so I think it should not be a blocking issue. : )

[1] : http://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=9239106764752777506&hl=it&as_sdt=0,5&as_vis=1
content.html:
I don't know... I have the impression that the fact that you need an _offset argument to specify its point of application means that this vector is not a "free vector". Just to give a comparison, a function like AddLinkCouple(const math::Vector3 &_couple) would not need an _offset argument, because it does not matter where do you apply the couple.

Anyway unless we use a formal semantic definition for this terms (as done in [1], for example) it is just a matter of taste, so I think it should not be a blocking issue. : )

[1] : http://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=9239106764752777506&hl=it&as_sdt=0,5&as_vis=1

content.raw:
I made a bunch of updates in [branch add_XXX_force_scpeters](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/add_XXX_force_scpeters..add_XXX_force#diff):

* Add `Matrix3::Inverse`
* Add `Link::GetWorldAngularMomentum`
* Fix `Link::Get*AngularAccel` functions
* add comments to test
* patch ODE bug (supplied by @hsu)

The new functions will require tests.
content.html:
I made a bunch of updates in branch add_XXX_force_scpeters:

  • Add Matrix3::Inverse
  • Add Link::GetWorldAngularMomentum
  • Fix Link::Get*AngularAccel functions
  • add comments to test
  • patch ODE bug (supplied by @hsu)

The new functions will require tests.
